Description: Fragment of wall of East Greek black-figured large bowl. On the slipped exterior, a bird and a feline, to left. Remaining are the wing, tail feathers, and one leg of the bird, and the forepaws (one upraised) of the feline; part of the centre-incised rosette in the field. Interior glazed black with added red and white bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Egyptian Museum, Cairo. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 16, no. 50, pl. 13)
Edgar 1911 / Catalogue Générale des antiquités égyptiennes du musée du Caire, Greek Vases (p. 13)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1052)
